steps.title: Launch site
details: Browser opened and successfully reached https://invoify.vercel.app.
Visual QA: 9/9 checks passed in first test; 8/9 in second (placeholder copy flagged).

steps.title: Look for Step-1 wizard (“Bill From” / “Bill To”)
details: Both tests waited 5 s for the h4 headings “Bill From :” or “Bill To :”.
Elements never appeared → hard failure that aborted the remainder of each scenario.

steps.title: (All subsequent form-entry, validation and persistence checks)
details: Because the wizard sections never appeared, steps 3-10 in Test 1 and 3-9 in Test 2 remained pending.

emotional_arc:
• Start: Curious/optimistic – site loads quickly.
• 0-5 s: Growing uncertainty – expected wizard not visible.
• 5 s+: Frustration – nothing to interact with, cannot continue task.
• End: Abandonment – user gives up before entering any data.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users arrive on homepage but can’t find where to begin—they expect to start invoicing immediately. Hidden or delayed entry points cause early drop-off.
next_actions: Add a clear, primary “Create invoice” CTA above the fold.
If the URL is meant to deep-link directly into the wizard, ensure it does so on first paint.
Display a skeleton/loader with messaging (“Loading invoice wizard…”) to reassure users during data fetch.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Elements failing to render within 5 s feel broken; slow initial loads drive bounce rates.
next_actions: Measure actual TTI for wizard components; budget <2 s.
Lazy-load heavy modules after first paint.
Use shimmer/skeleton states rather than blank page.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Extra spaces and trailing colons look unpolished and can break automated tests or screen-reader parsing.
next_actions: Trim redundant spaces in heading strings.
Follow semantic HTML (use <h2/3> only once per section).
Run automated linting to catch copy anomalies.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Generic placeholders (“Enter value…”) don’t guide users; UI review already flagged this.
next_actions: Replace with concrete examples (e.g., “Acme Corp., 123 Market St”).
Apply same pattern across all form fields.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Two separate tests failed at identical point, implying either environment data dependency or incorrect selector.
next_actions: Verify that ‘Bill From/To’ headings actually render; update selectors if markup changed.
Increase wait-time only after confirming functional load problem is fixed.

first_tackles.description: Surface a prominent “Create Invoice” button or auto-open the wizard when landing on /app route.
Trim heading strings and ensure consistent, semantic markup so elements are reliably discoverable by both users and automated tests.
Swap generic placeholders for real example data to boost form clarity and perceived professionalism.
Add skeleton loaders or progress indicators so users know the wizard is loading, preventing premature abandonment.
